## The Power
## of Open Source
Twenty is GPL-licensed. It means you own, not rent, the software. You get the simplicity of SaaS, with the freedom and cost savings of Open Source.
### Thriving community
Thriving community
A welcoming community of hundreds of developers that shares expertise and offers support.
A welcoming community of hundreds of developers that shares expertise and offers support.
Hundreds of contributors came together to build this software, creating a welcoming community that freely shares its expertise and offers support.

generated_description:
**Twenty - The Future of Open Source CRM**

Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator Batch S23, Twenty is capturing attention in the tech world by offering a modern alternative to traditional CRMs like Salesforce. Located in the heart of San Francisco, this compact team of three, backed by notable partner Dalton Caldwell, is on a mission to revolutionize how businesses manage customer relationships through open-source solutions.

What sets Twenty apart is its commitment to making customer relationship management both powerful and accessible. The platform allows users to fully own their software rather than renting it, thanks to its GPL licensing. You get the clean, user-friendly experience typical of SaaS products with the added freedom and customizability of open-source. Think of it as the Swiss Army knife for CRM—robust, flexible, and designed to adapt to the fast-paced environment of a growing company. 

Twenty's marketing pitch rightly claims it to be the "#1 Open Source CRM." It allows users to design workflows tailored to their business needs, making it perfect for companies that need to pivot quickly. Its functionality includes powerful APIs, customizable objects, and support for integrating various data sources. 

But the appeal of Twenty goes beyond just functionality. It fosters a thriving community where developers share expertise and contribute to continuous improvement of the platform. If you’re missing a feature, you can easily start a conversation or contribute code. It’s all about building something better, together.

The feedback from users has been overwhelmingly positive, with community members expressing excitement about the project and its potential impact in the market. Developers, businesses, and enthusiasts alike are recognizing the momentum behind Twenty as a serious contender in the CRM space.

As the landscape of software continues to evolve, Twenty represents not just a tool, but a movement towards transparency, customization, and user empowerment in customer relationship management. It’s not just about managing data—it’s about owning your CRM and leveraging it as a strategic asset for growth. 

So whether you're tired of traditional CRM systems and their restrictions, or just looking to explore the powerful capabilities of open source, check out [Twenty](https://twenty.com) to take charge of your customer relationships and be part of this exciting community.
